intro: Appendicula anceps var. anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leaved marsh gentian, is a flowering plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in Europe. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. This species is adapted to water-saturated soils and plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
